canPlace() Netscript Function

canPlace(worldX, worldY, rotation, fragmentId)
RAM cost

0.5 GB

Arguments

  • worldX (int()) – World X against which to align the top left of the fragment.

  • worldY (int()) – World Y against which to align the top left of the fragment.

  • rotation (int()) – A number from 0 to 3, the mount of 90 degree turn to take.

  • fragmentId (int()) – ID of the fragment to place.

Returns

true if the fragment can be placed at that position. false otherwise.

Example:
